cdata.text:
This bill requires the Department of Energy to report to Congress on Puerto Rico's progress toward rebuilding the electric grid and on the federal government's efforts to expedite such rebuilding.

Such report must contain

  • an analysis of the state of Puerto Rico's electric grid;
  • information on accountability measures the federal government is implementing or planning to implement to oversee the work that the government of Puerto Rico, the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority, and private sector entities are carrying out in the rebuilding of the grid;
  • an analysis of the role of the Financial Oversight and Management Board for Puerto Rico in the rebuilding of the grid;
  • recommendations for private sector entities and governments to reduce the number of outages and blackouts;
  • proposals for legislative actions and funding needed to improve the process of fund disbursement for critical projects related to electric grids; and
  • a plan for expediting such rebuilding by not later than three months after the report is submitted.

bill.title: To require a report on Puerto Rico's progress toward rebuilding the electric grid and detailing the efforts the Federal Government is undertaking to expedite such rebuilding, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
